meanings.definition: A person who is confined in prison.
meanings.sent1: The prisoners were sad to be away from their families.
meanings.sent2: The police officers escorted the prisoners to their cells.
meanings.sent3: The prisoners tried to play hide-and-seek in the small cell.
meanings.sent4: Her guilt was a prisoner in her own mind, trapping her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The prisoners' uniforms were a stark reminder of their confinement.

meanings.definition: A group of people held captive or confined.
meanings.sent1: The group of prisoners worked together to escape the enemy camp.
meanings.sent2: The prisoners of war were treated with respect by the soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The prisoners of the haunted house screamed in delight.
meanings.sent4: Their fear was a prisoner, binding them to their captors.
meanings.sent5: The prisoners huddled together for warmth in the cold dungeon.
